summary: if i have to hear one more man tell me captain marvel was too manly, too emotional, and they didn’t like how jude law was a...
body:
if i have to hear one more man tell me captain marvel was too manly, too emotional, and they didn’t like how jude law was a villain i will throw myself out a window. 

carol danvers is strong as fuck, capable of anything, and your tiny-ass brain couldn’t handle it. step. off.

reblog.comment:
if i have to hear one more man tell me captain marvel was too manly, too emotional, and they didn’t like how jude law was a villain i will throw myself out a window. 

carol danvers is strong as fuck, capable of anything, and your tiny-ass brain couldn’t handle it. step. off.

summary: Templarhalo reviews Captain Marvel
title: Templarhalo reviews Captain Marvel
body:
Well this was certainly worth  the hype.  Captain Marvel goes higher, further and faster than previous MCU movies ,due to a number of factors.

First, off the scale  is smaller.   Captain Marvel does not set out  to be epic in scale or scope or be the best movie since The Matrix.  A movie that was, and always be, ahead of its time.   It keeps its focus on Carol and its strong supporting cast.  Nothing feels padded or rushed.

Second the strong supporting cast.  Sam Jackson and Clark Gregg both return as their beloved characters,  but it is Ben Mendelson as Talos, and  Lashaa Lynch and Akela Akba as Maria Rambeau and Monica Rambeau who steal the show.    While the focus is on Carol and her story, the supporting characters play a much larger role,  with little Monica helping choose the colors for Carol’s suit or  Maria proving herself as much  a baddas as Carol.  These characters  simply aren’t there just for the demands in the plot.  They drive the story foward as much as Carol.

Third is that is does not lay on the feminism,  It prefers a show don’t tell and Quality over quantity approach, keeping the strengh of its message and themes  undiluted.   the little montage of Carol getting back up,   Gwen Stafani’s I’m just a girl” playing during the climatic fight scene.   Carol’s line to  Yon-Rogg about she doesn’t need to prove herself to him were all my favorite moments.

Overall i would have preferred a work that was more truer to the text,  but I enjoyed every second of Captain Marvel.

summary: I really liked the small plot twist that Talos wanted to find Mar-Vell's laboratory to find his family, because I feel like...
body: I really liked the small plot twist that Talos wanted to find Mar-Vell’s laboratory to find his family, because I feel like usually it would be different. You know, like the trope where a trusted character reveals that they were lying to get the power or other plot related thing. But Talos doesn’t seem to care about the Tesseract, but he cares about his family and his people. And I love Carol’s “He didn’t come here for the Tesseract” because it’s just so pure

summary: 'Marvel Is Becoming Too Political,' Says Man Who Has No Idea Why Comic Books Were Created In The First Place
